newsitem.title: USA: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Wall St favors SL Green.
newsitem.headline: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Wall St favors SL Green.

text.p: Wall Street investors smiled on shares of new issue SL Green Realty Corp on Friday, bumping the company's stock to nearly four points above its pricing offer during its first day of trade.
In its $210 million initial public offering, the real estate investment trust company priced at 21, the top of its pricing range assigned by underwriter Lehman Brothers.

SL Green, which specializes in renovating office buildings in Manhattan that are 25 years or older, then opened at 25 on the New York Stock Exchange; its highest trading price by late afternoon was 25RE
Other initial public offerings to hit U.S. markets Friday also told winning stories.
Trendwest Resorts, for example, priced at 18 and opened at 19-1/2. The company, underwritten by Montgomery Securities Inc, later traded at 20-7/8 before receding to 20.

LeukoSite Inc saw small gains after pricing two points below range at six. The biopharmaceutical company, which researches potential treatments for cancer and autoimmune diseases, traded at 6-1/4 in the early afternoon.

Also posting a first-day gain was the technology company Aehr Test Systems, which opened at 14-3/4, surpassing its pricing of 12, and later traded at 14-1/2. The company, underwritten by Oppenheimer, develops systems designed to reduce the cost of testing DRAMS and other memory devices in computers.

Mexico's second largest broadcaster, TV Azteca, also fared well during its debut on the NYSE. Azteca's American Depositary Receipts priced at 18-1/4 Thursday evening to open at 19-1/2, before dropping back to 19-1/8. The deal was underwritten by Bear Stearns.
